arts.ttl: Colchester United boss hails 'great win' at Newport County
arts.sum: "We had a brilliant start to the game, really bright, and then obviously lost Lyle, with a serious injury. After early chances for Arthur Read, Oscar Thorn and Samson Tovide at Rodney Parade, they lost Lyle Taylor to injury inside the opening quarter of an hour.

arts.ttl: Colchester strike late to snatch victory at Newport and boost play-offs chances
arts.sum: Fiacre Kelleher scored a header with two minutes remaining before Anthony Scully wrapped up victory in stoppage time.

arts.ttl: Kyreece Lisbie delighted to be back at Colchester United
arts.sum: "I was enjoying my football at Braintree but the ultimate goal is to be here with Colchester in the first team, so happy to be back. He added: "My aim was to impact the game with my qualities, my pace.

arts.ttl: Squad boost for Colchester boss on Newport County trip
arts.sum: And Cowley praised the spirit among his players, adding: "Credit to the group how we took four points from the Gillingham and Notts County games, a remarkable effort from everybody in terms of the illness and injuries. Players playing out of position, everybody putting the team before themselves.

arts.ttl: Colchester United's Danny Cowley named manager of month
arts.sum: And although their five-match winning run came to an end in a 4-1 loss at Bradford and they also lost to Grimsby, a haul of 15 points from a possible 21 has left them on the brink of the play-off places. He added: "We've got an office that has got the manager of the month awards, some awards for end of season, shirts of all the teams I've managed, from Concord Rangers to Braintree to Lincoln, Huddersfield, Portsmouth and now to Colchester.

Newport's 3-2 defeat to Carlisle last weekend was their seventh defeat in their last 10 league games. Colchester's 1-0 win over play off rivals Notts County last weekend was their first win in three ...
